documents.document: November 20 is Universal Children’s Day. And while we can celebrate the joy children give us it’s also good to rememberÂ 57 million children around the world don’t go to school and 70% of child deaths are attributable to diarrhoea, malaria, neonatal infection, pneumonia, preterm delivery or lack of oxygen at birth. If you still need Christmas cards this year, or would like to give a gift of cards, consider this ‘people series’ range from Visited Planet. Individual cards are $1.50 each or the following packs are available: 8 pack (1 of each card) $10 16 pack (2 of each card) $16 Card Quality: 4 colour process

A calendar is the perfect gift at this time of year or to use yourself in your bathroom, kitchen, office etc. You can’t have enough calendars! Visited Planet is selling two 2014 calendar products, one featuring world images from the database and the other images by children in Yangon. Both raise money for Cameras for

December 10 is Human Rights Day. On this day we remember the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and its call for liberty, justice and freedom for all people regardless of race, creed, caste and gender. Unfortunately the goals noted down in 1948 are still but an aspiration for many people around the world. This year

This week I have been reflecting on the life of Nelson Mandela in preparation for an article heralding his legacy for Gale. I came across these quotes that are worth reflecting on, even if you’ve read them before. RIP Nelson Mandela. Like slavery and apartheid, poverty is not natural. It is man-made and it can
